UI_visible_response: Numerous witness accounts confirm that Vocational Skills Education Training Center (VSETC)-linked employment can constitute a severe form of forced labor, suggesting that Uyghurs and other Muslims may be forcibly held in these centers1. Additionally, it has been argued that China's campaign of reeducation and forced labor in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region (XUAR) through so-called “Vocational Skills” programs involves the persecution of the Uighur Muslim community4. These sources indicate that there are significant concerns about the conditions and coercive nature of these facilities.
traffic_visible_response: Numerous witness accounts confirm that Vocational Skills Education Training Center (VSETC)-linked employment can constitute a severe form of forced labor, implying that Uyghurs and other Muslims may be forcibly held in these centers [[1]]. Additionally, it has been argued that China's campaign of reeducation and forced labor in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region (XUAR) involves so-called “Vocational Skills” training, which suggests the presence of coercive practices [[4]]. These sources indicate that there are significant concerns about the conditions and freedoms of individuals, particularly Uyghurs and other Muslim groups, within VSETCs.
